subject: AI & Agents
title: How a Single Neuron Works
description: One-minute skill: How a Single Neuron Works.

hook.text: One artificial neuron: multiply inputs by weights, add them up, apply a function. That's it.

buildup.text: Each neuron receives inputs, multiplies each by a learned weight, sums them, and adds a bias.

discovery.text: An activation function then decides whether the neuron 'fires' â€” introducing non-linearity.

twist.text: One neuron can only learn a straight line. Millions of them together can learn anything.

climax.text: This simple unit, repeated billions of times, powers every neural network in existence.

punchline.text: Multiply, add, activate. The atom of intelligence.

quiz.question: What does an activation function do in a neuron?
options: Introduces non-linearity so the network can learn complex patterns
Connects the neuron to the internet
